entity1.name: Modern Medicine
entity1.description: The science and practice of the diagnosis, treatment, and prevention of disease.;;;The simulation of human intelligence processes by machines, especially computer systems, used to analyze and interpret complex medical data.;;;Professionals who deliver healthcare services to patients, including doctors, nurses, and other medical staff.;;;Sophisticated tools and techniques used in healthcare for diagnosis, treatment, and prevention of diseases.;;;A branch of medicine that uses various techniques to visualize internal structures for diagnostic and therapeutic purposes.;;;Methods and practices used in performing surgical operations.;;;A set of contemporary methods and techniques used in the field of medicine for diagnosing, treating, and preventing diseases.;;;A minimally invasive surgical procedure used to examine or operate on the abdominal cavity using a laparoscope, a long, thin tube with a high-intensity light and a high-resolution camera at the front.;;;Medical doctors who practice in the field of medicine, diagnosing and treating patients.;;;Medical doctors who practice medicine to maintain or restore human health through the study, diagnosis, and treatment of disease and injury.;;;Professionals or institutions responsible for providing health care services to patients.;;;The branch of medical science concerned with the diagnosis, treatment, and prevention of disease using contemporary knowledge and techniques.;;;Surgical techniques that minimize the size of incisions and reduce trauma to the body, leading to faster recovery times and less pain for patients.;;;The branch of medical science that focuses on the diagnosis, treatment, and prevention of diseases using contemporary knowledge and techniques.;;;Magnetic Resonance Imaging, a medical imaging technique used to visualize detailed internal structures of the body.;;;Devices that can be worn on the body, often equipped with sensors to monitor health-related data and transmit it for analysis or real-time feedback.;;;The science and practice of diagnosing, treating, and preventing disease.;;;The application of organized knowledge and skills in the form of devices, medicines, vaccines, procedures, and systems developed to solve a health problem and improve quality of life.;;;Computed Tomography scans, a medical imaging procedure that uses X-rays and computer processing to generate detailed images of the inside of the body.;;;A method of delivering healthcare services remotely using telecommunications technology.;;;The maintenance and improvement of physical and mental health, especially through the provision of medical services.;;;The area of medical science and practice that uses advanced scientific knowledge and technology to diagnose, treat, and prevent diseases.;;;Procedures, treatments, and methods used in the field of medicine to diagnose, treat, and prevent diseases.;;;Tools used by medical professionals to diagnose diseases and conditions.;;;A branch of medicine that treats injuries, diseases, and deformities through operations.;;;The application of scientific knowledge to the practice of medicine, characterized by the use of advanced technology and research-driven treatments.

entity3.name: ancient civilizations
entity3.description: Societies that existed in the distant past, often characterized by their significant contributions to human knowledge and culture.

entity4.name: modern era
entity4.description: The recent period in history characterized by significant advancements in technology, science, and society.;;;A period characterized by significant scientific and technological advancements.
entity4.chunkid: The Development of Modern Medicine3;;;The Development of Modern Medicine15

entity7.name: human anatomy
entity7.description: The study of the structure of the human body, including its organs, tissues, and other components.;;;The branch of biology that deals with the functions and activities of living organisms and their parts.;;;The study of the structure and organization of the human body.
entity7.chunkid: The Development of Modern Medicine4;;;The Development of Modern Medicine29

entity9.name: human body
entity9.description: The physical structure of a human being, including all its organs and systems.

entity10.name: illnesses and diseases
entity10.description: Conditions caused by pathogenic microorganisms that can be transmitted from one individual to another.;;;Drugs used to treat bacterial infections by killing or inhibiting the growth of bacteria.;;;Infections caused by viruses, often requiring antiviral medications or vaccines for prevention and treatment.;;;Health conditions that affect the body or mind, causing discomfort, dysfunction, or distress.;;;Pathological conditions affecting the body or mind, often caused by microorganisms.;;;Infections caused by bacteria, which can be treated with antibiotics.
entity10.chunkid: The Development of Modern Medicine9;;;The Development of Modern Medicine5;;;The Development of Modern Medicine10

entity11.name: supernatural causes
entity11.description: Beliefs in phenomena that are beyond scientific explanation and often attributed to divine or spiritual forces.

entity12.name: Renaissance period
entity12.description: A cultural movement that spanned from the 14th to the 17th century, marking a revival of art, science, and learning in Europe.

entity13.name: Andreas Vesalius
entity13.description: A Flemish anatomist and physician who is often referred to as the founder of modern human anatomy due to his detailed dissections and publications.

entity16.name: Louis Pasteur
entity16.description: A French biologist, microbiologist and chemist renowned for his discoveries of the principles of vaccination, microbial fermentation and pasteurization.

entity17.name: Robert Koch
entity17.description: A German physician and microbiologist who was one of the main founders of modern bacteriology. He identified the specific causative agents of tuberculosis, cholera, and anthrax.

entity18.name: 19th century
entity18.description: The period from 1801 to 1900, during which significant scientific advancements were made, including the development of germ theory.

entity19.name: germ theory
entity19.description: A model that explains the cause of infectious diseases by proposing that microorganisms are responsible for causing disease.

entity21.name: microorganisms
entity21.description: Microscopic living organisms that can cause diseases.;;;Microscopic organisms, some of which can cause disease.
entity21.chunkid: The Development of Modern Medicine29;;;The Development of Modern Medicine10

entity25.name: vaccines
entity25.description: Biological preparations that provide active acquired immunity to specific diseases.

entity28.name: This breakthrough
entity28.description: A significant development or discovery that has had a positive impact on public health.

entity29.name: 20th century
entity29.description: A period of 100 years from the year 1901 to 2000.

entity31.name: X-ray
entity31.description: A form of electromagnetic radiation used in medical imaging to visualize internal structures.

entity32.name: Wilhelm Roentgen
entity32.description: The physicist who invented the X-ray, a significant contributor to the field of medical science.

entity33.description: The year in which Wilhelm Roentgen invented the X-ray.

entity36.name: fractures
entity36.description: A break or crack in a bone, often diagnosed using X-ray imaging.

entity37.name: tumors
entity37.description: Abnormal growths of tissue that can be benign or malignant, detectable through medical imaging techniques like X-rays.;;;A group of diseases characterized by uncontrolled cell growth that can invade and damage surrounding tissues and organs.
entity37.chunkid: The Development of Modern Medicine13;;;The Development of Modern Medicine20

entity38.name: pneumonia
entity38.description: An inflammatory condition of the lung affecting primarily the microscopic air sacs known as alveoli, often diagnosed using chest X-rays.

entity44.name: William Morton
entity44.description: A 19th-century dentist and medical innovator who introduced the use of ether anesthesia for surgery.

entity45.name: anesthesia
entity45.description: The process of administering medication to prevent pain during surgical procedures.

entity49.name: pharmaceutical industry
entity49.description: Companies that research, develop, and manufacture drugs and medical therapies.;;;A sector of the economy that focuses on developing, manufacturing, and marketing drugs for use as medications.
entity49.chunkid: The Development of Modern Medicine20;;;The Development of Modern Medicine18

entity51.name: penicillin
entity51.description: An antibiotic derived from the fungus Penicillium, used to treat bacterial infections.

entity52.name: Alexander Fleming
entity52.description: A Scottish physician and microbiologist who discovered penicillin in 1928.

entity53.description: The year when Alexander Fleming discovered penicillin, marking the beginning of the antibiotic era.

entity55.name: diabetes
entity55.description: A chronic disease characterized by high blood sugar levels due to the body's inability to produce or effectively use insulin.

entity56.name: hypertension
entity56.description: A medical condition where the pressure in the arteries is persistently elevated, also known as high blood pressure.

entity58.name: personalized medicine
entity58.description: An approach to healthcare that customizes medical treatment to the individual characteristics of each patient, often using genetic information.

entity59.name: technology
entity59.description: The application of scientific knowledge for practical purposes, especially in industry and healthcare.;;;Refers to the standards of medical care and the results achieved through healthcare services.
entity59.chunkid: The Development of Modern Medicine22;;;The Development of Modern Medicine26

entity65.name: electronic health records
entity65.description: Digital versions of patient medical charts that are maintained in an electronic format.

entity67.name: patients
entity67.description: Individuals receiving medical treatment or care from healthcare providers.

entity69.name: marginalized communities
entity69.description: Groups of people who are excluded from the mainstream society, often due to economic or social factors.

entity70.name: essential medical services
entity70.description: Necessary healthcare services that are vital for maintaining health and well-being.

entity71.name: policymakers
entity71.description: Individuals or groups responsible for making and implementing policies, often in government or organizational settings.

entity73.name: the public
entity73.description: The general population or community at large.

entity75.name: human ingenuity
entity75.description: The creative skills, cleverness, and resourcefulness of human beings in solving problems or inventing new things.

entity76.name: innovation
entity76.description: The process of introducing new ideas, methods, or products to improve existing systems or create entirely new ones.
